tl17-egypt.name: Egyptian revolution of 2011
tl17-egypt.description: The Egyptian revolution was a series of protests against the rule of the Egyptian government under Hosni Mubarak.

tl17-bpoil.name: Deepwater Horizon oil spill
tl17-bpoil.description: The Deepwater Horizon oil spill is an industrial disaster that began on April 20, 2010, in the Gulf of Mexico on the BP-operated Macondo Prospect.

tl17-mj.name: Death of Michael Jackson
tl17-mj.description: On June 25, 2009, the singer Michael Jackson died of acute propofol and benzodiazepine intoxication at his home on North Carolwood Drive in the Holmby Hills neighborhood of Los Angeles.

tl17-syria.name: Syrian Civil War
tl17-syria.description: The Syrian Civil War is an ongoing multi-sided armed conflict in Syria fought between the Ba'athist Syrian Arab Republic led by President Bashar al-Assad and various forces opposing the Syrian government and each other.

tl17-libya.name: Libyan Civil War of 2011
tl17-libya.description: The First Libyan Civil War was an armed conflict in 2011 in the North African country of Libya fought between forces loyal to Colonel Muammar Gaddafi and those seeking to oust his government.

tl17-h1n1.name: 2009 flu pandemic
tl17-h1n1.description: The 2009 flu pandemic or swine flu (H1N1) was an influenza pandemic that lasted from early 2009 to late 2010.

tl17-finan.name: Financial crisis of 2007â€“2008
tl17-finan.description: The finanancial crisis of 2007-2008 began in 2007 with a crisis in the subprime mortgage market in the United States, and developed into a full-blown international banking crisis.

tl17-haiti.name: 2010 Haiti earthquake and the subsequent relief effort
tl17-haiti.description: The 2010 Haiti earthquake was a catastrophic magnitude 7.0 earthquake that struck the island of Haiti.

tl17-iraq.name: Iraq War
tl17-iraq.description: The Iraq War was a protracted armed conflict that began in 2003 with the invasion of Iraq by a United States-led coalition that overthrew the government of Saddam Hussein and continued for much of the next decade as an insurgency.

crisis-syria.name: Syrian Civil War
crisis-syria.description: The Syrian Civil War is an ongoing multi-sided armed conflict in Syria fought between the Ba'athist Syrian Arab Republic led by President Bashar al-Assad and various forces opposing the Syrian government and each other.

crisis-libya.name: Libyan Civil War of 2011
crisis-libya.description: The First Libyan Civil War was an armed conflict in 2011 in the North African country of Libya fought between forces loyal to Colonel Muammar Gaddafi and those seeking to oust his government.

tl17-egypt.name: Egyptian revolution of 2011
tl17-egypt.description: The Egyptian revolution was a series of protests against the rule of the Egyptian government under Hosni Mubarak.

crisis-yemen.name: Yemeni Civil War
crisis-yemen.description: The Yemeni Civil War is an ongoing conflict that began in 2015 between two factions: the internationally recognized Yemeni government, led by Abdrabbuh Mansur Hadi, and the Houthi armed movement, along with their supporters and allies. Both claim to constitute the official government of Yemen.

crisis-egypt.name: Egyptian revolution of 2011
crisis-egypt.description: The Egyptian revolution was a series of protests against the rule of the Egyptian government under Hosni Mubarak.
